title: iPad App not optimized for landscape
text: The iPhone version of the app works well and I use it all the time, but the iPad version is basically just the iPhone app; it uses about 1/3 of the iPad screen. You're better off just going to the LI website if you're going to use your iPad.

title: Never seen this app crash this much
text: I’ve never seen this app be so problematic, it crashes during livestreams and during regular scrolling. And a feature to write articles on mobile (like I’ve asked for now for several years) would be nice.

title: Super Helpful
text: Great job searching tools and connections with other professionals.

title: Congratulations to Michelle Short
text: Congratulations on your 10th Anniversary at SHP Financial!  You are the most productive COO that SHP could imagine!  Here’s to another 10 years!

title: Find work?
text: I guess this app was meant for people looking for a job, but has devolved to just another social media site. Perhaps I’m biased and don’t consider my job to be a career, but I think it lost to essentially what it was about in the beginning. Use this app for social media purposes, but if you find a job along the way while you’re at, I guess that’s great too.

title: Glitches while job scrolling
text:
Considering the main purpose for this app is to look for open roles I am having a hard time doing so. I swipe up and nothing happens. No other app gives me this issue.

The job filters also don’t remain as selected

title: Forced ID verification
text: The app is ok, as expected for a service of this level, but they restricted my access, requesting ID verification through a third-party service, citing an unauthorized access attempt. After I complied and provided my ID, they lifted the restriction, without even strictly requiring a password change. This measure seems unrelated to actual account security, because, how it prevents attempts of unauthorized access by an intruder? They aim to boost the count of verified users, but their approach, to put it mildly, is impolite.

title: Reporting Profile Page Bug
text:
Hey Developer Team,

I just have a few possible bugs to report about this version of the app. I love the LinkedIn app. Great features. Quality user experience and interface. The app mirrors the desktop app very well.

Here are my concerns to report

• The LinkedIn app freezes when I go to my profile page regardless of how I try. I’ve swiped right on the screen and I’ve pressed my profile image in the top left corner to get to my profile. The app then freezes on the LinkedIn feed page.

• I’ve been invited to provide responses as an expert on a few LinkedIn led marketing articles or conversations. The articles mention receiving a “Top Voice in {Insert Industry}” badge when more than a few of these expert sourced articles are responded on. I haven’t received a badge for either of the industry categories I’ve been responding on.

title: Delete Skill not available
text: You cannot delete skills anymore in the app. You have to do it on the website.

title: Why Does This App Make You Delete Notifications ONE at a Time?
text: Love using the app but this is the most annoying thing. Any other app I can select multiple notifications to delete at a time if I needed. This one delete at a time is time consuming especially with the number of notifications I receive. Would be nice if this were changed.

title: Support with publish pictures
text: Hello LinkedIn team !For 14 hours I can’t put images to my page ,what’s a problem I don’t understand please solve it as fast as possible,because I can’t work ,thank you

title: Freezing screens!
text: With recent updates, I face the issue of the app freezing when opening profile or posts of some companies once the page is loaded and I have to restart the app again!
